customer_addr:
11002 Hill Top Road SW
Baltic, OH 43804

citations.narrative:
The licensee currently does not have an adequate method of identification for 9 litters of weaned and unweaned puppies
(29 puppies in total). The litters were born on various dates and the cage cards present do not contain individual
identification, sex, breed, or description of the puppies. Proper identification of puppies is important for disease traceback
and in cases of theft or loss. Correct by ensuring live puppies less than 16 weeks of age have proper identification, such
as an official tag, tattoo or microchip, APHIS 7005 form, or a cage card.
Correct by 24 December 2024

The facility is not following the program of veterinary care for vaccinations. The Program of Veterinary Care currently
prescribes dogs will be vaccinated for DAPP and Leptospirosis annually.
3 adult dogs are not up to date on their Distemper, Parvo, or Leptospirosis vaccines:
-Lela#4325 last administered on 3-7-2023
-Velvet#4333 last administered on 10-24-2023
-Flash#8520 last administered on 6-3-2023
1 adult dog did not have a record of a current Distemper or Parvo vaccine
-Lexy#0930
Failure to follow the preventative care schedule for vaccinations in the Program of Veterinary Care does not ensure the
dogs are receiving appropriate protection against contagious and deadly diseases such as distemper, parvo,
leptospirosis, and rabies which can lead to illness and discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the vaccination
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian in the Program of Veterinary Care to protect the dogs from deadly or
contagious diseases.
Correct by 24 December 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.50(a)(2) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
The licensee currently does not have an adequate method of identification for 9 litters of weaned and unweaned puppies 
(29 puppies in total). The litters were born on various dates and the cage cards present do not contain individual 
identification, sex, breed, or description of the puppies. Proper identification of puppies is important for disease traceback 
and in cases of theft or loss. Correct by ensuring live puppies less than 16 weeks of age have proper identification, such 
as an official tag, tattoo or microchip, APHIS 7005 form, or a cage card.  
Correct by 24 December 2024 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility is not following the program of veterinary care for vaccinations. The Program of Veterinary Care currently 
prescribes dogs will be vaccinated for DAPP and Leptospirosis annually.  
3 adult dogs are not up to date on their Distemper, Parvo, or Leptospirosis vaccines: 
-Lela#4325 last administered on 3-7-2023 
-Velvet#4333 last administered on 10-24-2023 
-Flash#8520 last administered on 6-3-2023 
1 adult dog did not have a record of a current Distemper or Parvo vaccine 
-Lexy#0930 
Failure to follow the preventative care schedule for vaccinations in the Program of Veterinary Care does not ensure the 
dogs are receiving appropriate protection against contagious and deadly diseases such as distemper, parvo, 
leptospirosis, and rabies which can lead to illness and discomfort to the dogs. The facility must follow the vaccination 
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian in the Program of Veterinary Care to protect the dogs from deadly or 
contagious diseases.  
Correct by 24 December 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
 n
